page.title: 03MAIDSTONE TRAFFIC CONGESTION
page.content: Maidstone's recent rapid residential growth has greatly increased pressure on the town centre's road system and only Medway crossing. Single incidents cause lengthy tailbacks, especially - {1.Where the A20 and A249 converge east {of the town centre-i.e. top of Square {Hill and bottom of Sittingbourne Road. {2.Along the 4-lane, single-carriageway {Loose Road through squares 7653 and {7654 and its extension as a one-way {system north of 764548. At the morning {peak a third of this traffic is making {for west of the bridge and a third for {destinations north of Maidstone. Traffic along the southern artery has also been increased by private haulage depots in the nearby countryside and by Park Wood Industrial Estate in sq. 7852. Heavy lorries soon overload road surfaces and the necessary roadworks cause further delays.
